definition: bold and decisive
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
surname Dao
variant of 闊|阔[kuo4]
rich/wide/broad
hatchet

sentences.english: He would slay the system, like the Terminator.
sentences.chinese: 他会像终结者那样大刀阔斧改革不正常的机制。

sentences.english: Burdened with no fardel of the past, he has boldly taken the initiative.
sentences.chinese: 但是他无历史包袱，以大刀阔斧决断争取主动。

sentences.english: He knows voters are clamoring for decisive action to stop the country's slide into economic malaise.
sentences.chinese: 他知道选民要求政府采取大刀阔斧的行动挽救经济。

sentences.english: But the heavy hand of the government can be stifling here.
sentences.chinese: 但是政府这种大刀阔斧的做法可能会适得其反。

sentences.english: You don't need to take huge steps, just smalls.
sentences.chinese: 你不必要大刀阔斧，只是需要平时小小的投资。
国会大刀阔斧地削减预算。

sentences.english: Instead, Mr Razaleigh's candidacy was quashed by party chiefs.
sentences.chinese: 但是政党首领却大刀阔斧，削去了拉沙理的候选资格。

definition: to destroy the old and establish the new (idiom)/radical transformation
reform/CL:次[ci4],種|种[zhong3],項|项[xiang4]/to reform
aggressive and grand (idiom); ambitious/pushy
to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
pass like thunder and move like the wind (idiom); swift and decisive reaction
iron fist (of the state)
to have free rein (idiom)
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
sky and the earth turning upside down (idiom); fig. complete confusion/everything turned on its head
change of string, move out of rut (idiom); dramatic change of direction/to dance to a different tune
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to delegate power/to decentralize
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
to tidy up/to reorganize/to consolidate/to rectify
complete change (idiom); facelift/We're in a wholly new situation.
